Skin Laundry Technical Assessment 1 Welcome to the Skin Laundry App

Skin Laundry Technical Assessment Austin Kolvek 2025-01-11 1 Welcome to the Skin Laundry App The goal of this assessment is to take the data Skin Laundry has provided and build a forecasting model that will predict future demand for their Hyaluronic Acid Serum at clinic G during Q3 of 2024 (July - September 2024).

2 EDA #Import Data, Clean Data, and Subset Down import pandas as pd data = pd.read_csv(r'C:\Users\austi\OneDrive\Documents\Interviews\Skin Laundry\Clinic Product Sales Data.csv') Lets take a look at the first couple of observations! #Set the display up so we can see all of the columns pd.set_option('display.max_columns', None) print(data.head()) ## clinic area clinic name sale date guest user id \ ## 0 Region B Clinic G 1/2/2022 2327eb10-952d-431f-8e97-61d37b81944d ## 1 Region A Clinic E 1/5/2022 ace86dd7-8bfc-4c59-ae96-62aeb14fc843 ## 2 Region B Clinic G 1/8/2022 668a1fb3-b42f-425b-8252-4876779cc7b3 ## 3 Region A Clinic E 1/9/2022 ec01a76e-b6fa-4209-8ffb-0a8b7e7934dd ## 4 Region A Clinic E 1/12/2022 6aa914d4-65e0-4dc1-a211-1c85b3f602a8 ## ## product name product category quantity sold ## 0 TA Tranexamic Acid Serum Serum 1 ## 1 Hyaluronic Acid Serum Serum 1 ## 2 Hyaluronic Acid Serum Serum 1 ## 3 TA Tranexamic Acid Serum Serum 1 ## 4 TA Tranexamic Acid Serum Serum 1 Right away, some of the columns that don’t seem to be needed are “guest user id, product category, and clinic area. Lets check the unique values of product category to make sure we can drop it print(data['product category'].unique()) ## ['Serum'] “Serum” is the only value for the category, so we are good to drop this column as it provides no info for us Lets drop the columns we stated above. data = data.drop(columns=['clinic area','guest user id','product category']) print(data.head()) ## clinic name sale date product name quantity sold ## 0 Clinic G 1/2/2022 TA Tranexamic Acid Serum 1 ## 1 Clinic E 1/5/2022 Hyaluronic Acid Serum 1 ## 2 Clinic G 1/8/2022 Hyaluronic Acid Serum 1 ## 3 Clinic E 1/9/2022 TA Tranexamic Acid Serum 1 ## 4 Clinic E 1/12/2022 TA Tranexamic Acid Serum 1 Next I am going to subset the data down to info that Skin Laundry as specified subset_data = data[(data['clinic name'] == 'Clinic G') & (data['product name'] == 'Hyaluronic Acid Serum')] print(subset_data.head()) ## clinic name sale date product name quantity sold ## 2 Clinic G 1/8/2022 Hyaluronic Acid Serum 1 ## 8 Clinic G 1/15/2022 Hyaluronic Acid Serum 1 ## 9 Clinic G 1/17/2022 Hyaluronic Acid Serum 1 ## 16 Clinic G 1/23/2022 Hyaluronic Acid Serum 1 ## 17 Clinic G 1/24/2022 Hyaluronic Acid Serum 1 # Cut the data down to the correct time range from the beginning of 2022 to # September 2024 # Define the start and end date for the time range start_date = '1/2/2022' end_date = '9/30/2024' # Filter the data based on the time range subset_data = subset_data[(subset_data['sale date'] >= start_date) & (subset_data['sale date'] <= end_date)] Next I am going to make sure the our variables are of correct type. Any variables that are not of the correct type, I will correct accordingly. print(subset_data.info()) ## <class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'> ## Index: 1353 entries, 2 to 16420 ## Data columns (total 4 columns): ## # Column Non-Null Count Dtype ## --- ------ -------------- ----- ## 0 clinic name 1353 non-null object ## 1 sale date 1353 non-null object ## 2 product name 1353 non-null object ## 3 quantity sold 1353 non-null int64 ## dtypes: int64(1), object(3) ## memory usage: 52.9+ KB ## None I am going to change the “sale date” column to a datetime data type subset_data.loc[:, 'sale date'] = pd.to_datetime(subset_data['sale date']) Next we are going to check fo NA values print(subset_data.isna().sum()) ## clinic name 0 ## sale date 0 ## product name 0 ## quantity sold 0 ## dtype: int64 We have 0 NA values! Lets count how many Hyaluronic Acid Serums clinic G has sold in total print(subset_data.groupby('product name')['quantity sold'].sum()) ## product name ## Hyaluronic Acid Serum 1394 ## Name: quantity sold, dtype: int64 I am going to save the clean data and pull it into R to build my time series model subset_data.to_csv('subset_data.csv', index=False) Clinic G for Skin Laundry has sold a total of 1,394 Hyaluronic Acids Serums from January 2022-September 2024! Moving forward, I will build a time series forecast that will look at the patterns in the data to predict demand for the Hyaluronic Acid Serum in Q3 of 2024
